title: This Multitool Is Built on a Bike Chain
text:
This Multitool Is Built on a Bike Chain 
For under ten bucks, it's quite stylish. By David Grossman Jan 31, 2017 You can do so much with a multitool, but they can be easy to lose or hard to carry around. That is, unless you turn one into something you can comfortably wear around your wrist. That's what Laura Kampf did. Her secret? A "bicycle chain, steel scraps and some bits and screwdrivers." They're cheap (under ten bucks, she says), they're shiny, and they fit perfectly. Bicycle chains can be used for as many different types of projects , as can multitools.   All over the place, multitools are changing their shape. Knife maker SOG has been at the forefront, by fitting multi-tools into everything from belt buckles to pens . Kampf's design was inspired by the Leatherman Tread . We'll probably see them turned into even more creative shapes in the years to come. More from Popular Mechanics:
